head.title: Bush and Gore, on the Battleground of Ideas

hedline.hl1: Bush and Gore, on the Battleground of Ideas

abstract.p: Dr Herbert S Gross letter on Richard A Epstein's Sept 7 article agrees with his criticism of both George W Bush's and Al Gore's proposals to cover prescription drugs for elderly under Medicare and suggests alternative approach

block.p: Re ''Competing to Make Things Worse,'' by Richard A. Epstein (Op-Ed, Sept. 7): Mr. Epstein aptly criticizes both candidates' proposals to cover prescription drugs for the elderly. The economies achieved by privatization versus the security afforded by government-financed programs has become a partisan issue. This is good fare for debating, but the kiss of death for federal action.

Re ''Competing to Make Things Worse,'' by Richard A. Epstein (Op-Ed, Sept. 7): Mr. Epstein aptly criticizes both candidates' proposals to cover prescription drugs for the elderly. The economies achieved by privatization versus the security afforded by government-financed programs has become a partisan issue. This is good fare for debating, but the kiss of death for federal action.
Why not enliven the debate over adding prescription drug coverage by throwing in controlled tax-cutting for the elderly?

By giving the wealthy elderly a tax credit for their prescription coverage, by paying for the prescription coverage of the poor, and calculating a sliding scale for everyone else, we might have an experimental stalking horse for subsequent Medicare reform.
HERBERT S. GROSS, M.D. Rockville, Md., Sept. 8, 2000
